elements.label: Way: The Wood
elements.description: I've learnt the path to the Wood, the tangled darkness that grows around the walls of the Mansus (though the Mansus has no walls). I can Dream with this to return to the Wood.

elements.label: Way: The White Door
elements.description: In my dreams, I've passed the White Door, which has been called the Bone Door and the Gate of Ivory. My voice remains outside the House each time I enter.

elements.label: Stag Door's Riddle
elements.description: 'What may be lost?' Answer this riddle to pass the Stag Door, and be accounted a Know.

elements.label: Stag Door's Riddle
elements.description: 'Where is mercy found?' Answer this riddle to pass the Stag Door, and be accounted a Know.

elements.label: Stag Door's Riddle
elements.description: 'What are the words that make sacrifice sweet?' Answer this riddle to pass the Stag Door, and be accounted a Know.

elements.label: Stag Door's Riddle
elements.description: 'What must open, before this Way opens?' Answer this riddle to pass the Stag Door, and be accounted a Know.

elements.label: Stag Door's Riddle
elements.description: 'Where is the queen who was not born?' Answer this riddle to pass the Stag Door, and be accounted a Know.

elements.label: Way: Through the Stag Door
elements.description: In my dreams, I've found the way to the Stag Door, sometimes called the Horn Gate or the Adept's Door. I have answered its riddle, and am counted among the Know.

elements.label: Way: The Spider's Door
elements.description: In my dreams, I've found the way to the Spider's Door, sometimes called the Bloody Gate or, more informally, the Wrong Door.

elements.label: Way: The Peacock's Door
elements.description: In my dreams, I've found the way to the Peacock's Door, sometimes called the Gate of Eyes, or Pride's Dismay.
